title: Consumer Price Index of all urban consumers , by region 2019
summary: This is a bar chart representing Country in the x axis and Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) in the y axis.
The Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) is appeared to be the highest at Country West and lowest at Country Midwest.
There is a difference of 32.57 between the maximum Country West and minimum Country Midwest.
min_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) for 5 number of Countrys.
Country West has the highest Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) and Midwest has the lowest Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984).

max_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) for 5 number of Countrys.
Country West has the highest Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) and Midwest has the lowest Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984).
Second maximum Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) is found at Country .
The difference of Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) between the highest and lowest Country is 32.57.
Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) at Country West is 270.35 , second place is  at 255.66, and thirdly is U.S. city average at 255.66.
The lowest value 237.78 at Midwest is almost 1.06 times smaller than the average value 255.89.
